title: Add DIY minimal logging to agent-relay daemon
description:
Implement a lightweight ~20-line logging approach for the agent-relay daemon. No external library needed.

Requirements:
- log_info(), log_warn(), log_error(), log_debug() functions
- JSON output format for easy parsing with jq
- Configurable via LOG_FILE and DEBUG env vars
- Log daemon startup/shutdown
- Log errors (delivery failures, connection issues)
- Debug-only message delivery logging
- Minimal performance impact (sub-5ms system)

Implementation:
```bash
_log() {
    local level="$1" msg="$2"
    local ts=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
    printf '{"ts":"%s","level":"%s","msg":"%s"}\n' "$ts" "$level" "$msg" >> "$LOG_FILE"
    [[ "$LOG_STDOUT" == "1" ]] && echo "[$level] $msg"
}

log_info()  { _log "INFO"  "$1"; }
log_warn()  { _log "WARN"  "$1"; }
log_error() { _log "ERROR" "$1"; }
log_debug() { [[ "${DEBUG:-0}" == "1" ]] && _log "DEBUG" "$1"; }
```

Files modified:
- src/utils/logger.ts (new file - TypeScript implementation)
- src/daemon/server.ts (integrated logging)
- src/utils/index.ts (exported logger)
closed_reason: Implemented TypeScript version with JSON output, configurable log levels, file logging support

title: [VIRAL] Public Community Rooms with AI Agents
description:
Create open, public rooms on Agent Relay where anyone can join and chat with AI agents. This is our viral growth mechanism - like Discord's open servers but with AI agents as first-class participants.

## Concept
Agent Relay's public landing page will feature open rooms:
- #help - Get help from AI agent + community
- #roadmap - Chat with roadmap agent about upcoming features
- #docs - Documentation agent answers questions
- #showcase - See live agent demos
- #general - Community discussion with AI moderation

## Requirements
1. Public rooms accessible without workspace (just GitHub login)
2. AI agents always present and responsive
3. Rate limiting for free users
4. Upgrade prompts for power users
5. Show agent activity in real-time (demonstrates product)
6. Shareable room links

## Growth Loop
1. User discovers Agent Relay
2. Joins public room, chats with agents
3. Gets hooked on AI-native collaboration
4. Creates own workspace to use agents on their code
5. Invites team members

## Implementation
- Add 'public' flag to rooms/channels
- Create dedicated community workspace
- Deploy always-on agents for each room
- Add guest/free tier with rate limits
- Embed rooms on landing page

title: Deploy Always-On Community Agents
description:
Deploy dedicated agents for public community rooms.

## Agents to Deploy
1. **DocsBot** - Answers documentation questions, links to relevant docs
2. **RoadmapBot** - Discusses features, collects feedback, shows roadmap
3. **HelpBot** - Troubleshooting, getting started, FAQ
4. **ShowcaseBot** - Demos agent capabilities interactively
5. **ModBot** - Community moderation, spam filtering

## Requirements
- Agents must be highly reliable (99.9% uptime)
- Fast response times (<2s)
- Trained on Agent Relay docs/codebase
- Personality guidelines for each
- Escalation path to humans

## Implementation

- Health monitoring
- Auto-restart on failure
- Usage analytics
